text: HubSpot only allows AJAX POSTs for the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form|Form Submissions API>. The others are all authenticated, meaning you would expose your means of authentication to anyone visiting your site if you were to make the request from the front end.
So I wouldn't be able to send a POST request to Chargebee?
oh I mis-understood. You are looking to send it from HubSpot to Chargebee?  That should be fine from the HubSpot end. What error are you running into?

I'm sending an AJAX POST request to Chargebee's API (_client-side, not server_) and it turns it into a GET request. When I set up off of HubSpot it sends as a POST. It throws me an error with the Headers CORS.
Looks like Chargebee doesnâ€™t support CORS requests <https://support.chargebee.com/support/discussions/topics/318601>
It's actually going to our companies app's server then Chargebee's. Which it does say you accept. Thank you for the help.
